title: Activity-induced reactivity of astrocytes impairs cognition
content:
by Kirsten Bohmbach, Christian Henneberger

Glial cells such as astrocytes can modulate neuronal signaling. Astrocytes can also acquire a reactive phenotype that correlates with cognitive impairments in brain diseases. A study in PLOS Biology shows that prolonged activation of astrocytes can trigger both cognitive impairments and a reactive astrocyte phenotype.
